net.objectzoo.events

Interface Event<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the information parameter the event provides
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    EventAsyncDelegate<T>, EventDelegate<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    EventAsyncAdapter, EventCaller, EventDistributor

    public interface Event<T>
    An Event is a source of signals and/or information that can be observed by subscribing Consumer instances to it. When an Event signals all subscribed Consumers are invoked. The order of of the invocation of the Consumers and the behavior in case of an RuntimeException during the invocation of a Consumer depends on the concrete Event implementation.
    Author:
    tilmann

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void subscribe(Consumer<? super T> consumer)
      Subscribe the given Consumer to this Event
      void unsubscribe(Consumer<? super T> consumer)
      Unsubscribe the given Consumer from this Event
